thread.title: Tax bill sails through parliament
thread.title_full: Tax bill sails through parliament | Business Spectator

author: AAP
title: Tax bill sails through parliament
text:
The Turnbull government has used the absence of a senator to push legislation through parliament that changes the transparency provisions of taxation laws.
Companies with income of more than $100 million will not have to publish tax information, a measure opposed by Labor, which argues it erodes public confidence.
The government on Thursday rushed the bill through the Senate when a senator scheduled to speak didn't turn up on time, relying on the votes of those in the chamber at the time.
